description: From Middle English almenak, from Old French almanach, from Medieval Latin almanachus, from Andalusian Arabic الْمَنَاخ‎ (al-manāḵ, “almanac, calendar”), from Arabic الْمُنَاخ‎ (al-munāḵ, “climate”).

entries.meaning: (astronomy, navigation) A book or table listing nautical, astronomical, astrological or other events for the year; sometimes, but not essentially, containing historical and statistical information.
A handbook, typically published annually, containing information on a particular subject
A GPS signal consisting of coarse orbit and status information for each satellite in the constellation.
